text: MSNBC is an American cable news channel started by NBCUniversal (NBC) and Microsoft (MSN), thus the name MSNBC. MSNBC is an American multinational news and political commentary television channel. It was started in 1996. It is produced by NBC's news division, NBC News. It replaced a channel Roger Ailes operated and founded for NBC called America's Talking, which launched in 1994. ==Shows== Most of its shows are shows that talk about news and politics, and are hosted by people such as Joy Reid, Rachel Maddow, Chris Hayes and Lawrence Oâ€™Donnell. There have been accusations of liberal bias made about MSNBC. MSNBC's motto is "Lean Forward". ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:American television networks Category:Cable television Category:1996 establishments in the United States
title: MSNBC
